Key Match Events: The White Sox had a brutal defensive blunder when Miguel Vargas collided with Andrew Benintendi while trying to catch a fly ball, allowing two more runs to score and extending the Orioles' lead to 7-0.
Post-Match Reflections: The White Sox's loss to the Orioles was their 109th of the season, leaving them just 11 defeats shy of tying the modern mark set by the 1962 Mets.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Orioles won 9-0 against the White Sox, with the White Sox committing a series of errors and mishaps, including Vargas's collision with Benintendi and the ejection of interim manager Grady Sizemore and Benintendi from the game.
Others: Miguel Vargas was taken out of the game with an abrasion on his right eye and will undergo further evaluation.
